chemoreception.notes: As parasites, Bucephalidae likely rely on chemoreception to locate hosts and suitable environments within the host. Inferred due to parasitic lifestyle.

mechanoreception.notes: Bucephalidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect changes in pressure or movement within their hosts. This is inferred based on their need to maintain position and respond to host physiology.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Bucephalidae is unknown based on the provided text. Given their parasitic lifestyle within hosts, photoreception is potentially reduced or absent in adult stages.
